basics.name: Dhiaa Mejdi
basics.summary: Research interests revolve around advancing the automation, interpretability, and scalability of data engineering pipelines using large language models (LLMs). Focused on generating, validating, and optimizing ETL workflows, improving MLOps processes, and bridging state-of-the-art NLP with robust, production-scale data engineering solutions.

work.name: ERGO GROUP AG
work.summary: Designed and automated scalable data pipelines for AWS-based data lakes, enabling efficient ingestion and transformation of health insurance data. Automated ETL workflows with Spark/PySpark, supported MLOps pipelines, and enabled RESTful model serving via FastAPI.
highlights: Reduced data preparation time from one month to one day
Integrated AWS SageMaker Pipelines and Docker for model lifecycle management
Contributed to CI/CD workflows for MLOps

work.name: Hahn-Schickard Gesellschaft für Angewandte Forschung e.V.
work.summary: Developed and integrated deep neural networks for product identification and spectral dimensionality reduction in an Industry 4.0 environment. Achieved 4.0 GPA, High Honours, and Jury Distinction.
highlights: Designed a Spectroscopic Process Analytical System for quality control
Applied advanced ML techniques (MLP, XGBoost) and feature analysis
Managed full project lifecycle from data collection to deployment

work.name: OliveSoft
work.summary: Managed service desk operations, JIRA/Confluence administration, and partner training. Maintained company web infrastructure and mentored on Azure and WordPress.

work.name: Udini (DeepSmile Lab)
work.summary: Implemented deployment workflows for DL models on AWS, explored quantization and compilation to reduce GPU memory footprint.
highlights: Technologies: Python, ONNX, TensorRT, AWS, CI/CD

work.position: Machine Learning Intern & Technology Unit Leader
work.name: Rouge International
work.summary: Built 'FUTURE Engine', an AI-powered search engine for ESG analytics.

work.name: ENIS, University of Sfax
work.summary: Developed a social user profiling system for personalized ads using multimodal ML models.
highlights: Implemented TunBERT, CNN, RNN, LSTM models

education.summary: DAAD KOSPIE scholarship recipient (top 10% acceptance rate)

education.area: Master's equivalent in Computer Science & Applied Mathematics Engineering

education.summary: First in class (Year 1), top 30% in national engineering school entrance exam

Social User Profiling for Personalized Advertisement Recommendation: A Multi-Modal Deep Learning Approach

teaching.description: Delivered lectures on Quality Management, Cybersecurity, .NET Architecture, Web Development, Microcontroller systems.
Led sessions on MLOps best practices, C++, competitive programming, and video editing.
Organized and delivered space and cybersecurity workshops for high school students.

awards.title: IEEE Regional Exemplary Student Branch Award
